title: Kentucky Butter Cake Recipe
description: This sweet Kentucky butter cake is drenched with a vanilla-flavored butter sauce while still warm, for moist texture and incredible flavor in every bite.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Yellow Cake Recipes Kentucky Butter Cake 4.6 (1,286) 1,057 Reviews 240 Photos This Kentucky butter cake is moist with a luscious butter sauce. It's made from readily available ingredients. Submitted by Suzanne Stull Updated on September 12, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 240 240 240 240 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 1 hr Additional Time: 30 mins Total Time: 1 hr 50 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 1 10-inch Bundt cake Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings Cake: 3 cups unbleached all-purpose flour 2 cups white sugar 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon baking powder ½ teaspoon baking soda 1 cup buttermilk 1 cup unsalted butter, softened 4 large eggs 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Butter Sauce: 3/4 cup white sugar 1/3 cup unsalted butter 3 tablespoons water 2 teaspoons vanilla extract Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch Bundt pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Make the cake: Mix flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together in a large bowl. Blend in buttermilk, butter, eggs, and vanilla with an electric mixer. Beat for 3 minutes on medium speed. Pour batter into the prepared pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until a wooden toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 1 hour. When the cake is almost finished baking, make the butter sauce: Combine sugar, butter, water, and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until fully melted and combined; do not boil. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove the cake from the oven. Prick holes in the still-warm cake, then slowly pour butter sauce over the top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Let cake cool before removing from pan, about 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,458 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 508 Calories 22g Fat 71g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 508 % Daily Value * Total Fat 22g 29% Saturated Fat 13g 67% Cholesterol 117mg 39% Sodium 336mg 15% Total Carbohydrate 71g 26% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 47g Protein 6g 12% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 67mg 5% Iron 2mg 10% Potassium 96mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Kentucky Butter Cake 01 of 240 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 240 Photo by  Yolanda Badelle 11/28/2024 This cake was super simple and delicious thanksgiving will be sweeter 03 of 240 Photo by  LankyOven5857 09/04/2023 I have to say this cake is delicious! I've made 3 in the past week for family and friends. I added a small box of vanilla pudding mix to the recipe. It makes the cake so moist! 04 of 240 Photo by  Gullahgal843 07/03/2023 And the crowd goes wiilllldddddd!! I mean every week I’m being asked to make this cake. I use my coworkers as taste testers(state food inspectors) because I’m always trying new desserts and this along with everything else I make for them was a hit! I’m ready to move on to the next sweet craving but they’re still stuck on the butter cake. First time I made it, I used almond extract since I thought I wouldn’t like the rum but the second time I made it, I used the rum. Both ways were good but most love the rum and the butter sauce/glaze that made the cake! That was everyone’s favorite part of the cake. Using unbleached flour does make a difference to me and makes the flavors of the cake stand out more.Third time I accidentally cooked it at 350 for a hour and 15 and I went into panic mode! Cake was still fine and gave the top a little sweet crunch that my family absolutely loved. This cake is addictive. Will be making again and again. 05 of 240 Photo by  TealSauce6945 03/11/2023 Absolutely Divine! I added a couple of teaspoons of Butter Emulsion along with the Vanilla Extract. Sooooo Good! 06 of 240 Photo by  Penny L Wilson 11/23/2022 The recipe called for 3 cups of flour but instructions said to mix 2 cups. This obviously was an error. 07 of 240 Photo by  TrustyMeal2745 10/31/2022 The first time I made the cake was so delicious. I used 3/4 cup of Truvia instead of 2 cups of white sugar! My husband loves it. Thank you for the recipe. 08 of 240 Photo by  SpiffySage8991 06/23/2022 Looked kind of blah, the syrup topping just ran off the top when I put it on, yes I poked holes, made slices, and spooned plenty. It ran down the sides and pooled at the bottom in the cake dish. It didn't appear to go down in the holes. It wasn't very attractive to look at, so I grabbed a can of cherry pie filling and spooned that around the top and then around the bottom. It looks much better now and more eye candy.As far as taste, we'll nothing really spectacular. It did taste good, and everyone complimented how good it was. One person even had seconds. The sugar topping was sugary. Maybe a powdered sugar would have had better consistency?Also, the cake was just a tad on the dry side. 09 of 240 Photo by  Jay Mo 05/18/2022 Absolutely amazing. Super tasty and buttery. It was such a hit! I didn't change a thing and it turned out wonderful. 10 of 240 Photo by  pax 04/05/2022 Love it! So did everyone who had a slice. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love British Butterfly Cakes 1 Rating Honey Bun Cake from Scratch 12 Ratings Boston Cream Pie I 91 Ratings Peanut Butter and Chocolate Chip Cupcakes 16 Ratings Almond Crunch Pound Cake 7 Ratings Bourbon Brownies 2 Ratings Lemon Polenta Biscuits 6 Ratings Basic Sugar Cookies - Tried and True Since 1960 27 Ratings Steph's Bourbon Balls 18 Ratings Pillowcase Cookies 1 Rating Texas Sheet Cake Cookies 8 Ratings Tea Cakes 20 Ratings Chai Tea Cookies 2 Ratings Banana Coconut Cake with Vanilla Glaze 4 Ratings Berry Almond Cake Butternut Squash Cookies 3 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Suzanne Stull
